009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.lang.reflect.Field;
014import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Interface to be implemented by local 'Parameters' classes. This is part of
024 * the 'simple parameter object' scheme, working with public fields. Only
025 * non-static, non-final, public fields are accepted as parameters. Current
026 * features include: <br>
027 * (a) Makes parameter bundles printable by listing all eligible fields. <br>
028 * (b) Parameter bundles can be added/modified as a whole by ImageJ's
029 * {@link GenericDialog}, supported by specific annotations (use methods
030 * {@link DialogUtils#addToDialog(ParameterBundle, GenericDialog)} and
031 * {@link DialogUtils#getFromDialog(ParameterBundle, GenericDialog)}). <br>
032 * See the example in {@code DemoParameters} below. Other functionality may be
033 * added in the future.
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * <pre>
037 * public class ClassToBeParameterized {
038 * 
039 *      enum MyEnum {  // local enum type
040 *              A, B, Cee
041 *      };
042 * 
043 *      // Sample parameter bundle class:
044 *      static class DemoParameters implements ParameterBundle&lt;ClassToBeParameterized&gt; {
045 *              public static int staticInt = 44; // currently static members are listed too!
046 * 
047 *              &#64;DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
048 *              public boolean someBool = true;
049 *              public int someInt = 39;
050 *              public float someFloat = 1.99f;
051 * 
052 *              &#64;DialogLabel("Math.PI")
053 *              &#64;DialogDigits(10)
054 *              public double someDouble = Math.PI;
055 *              public String someString = "SHOW ME";
056 * 
057 *              &#64;DialogHide
058 *              public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
059 *              public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
060 *      }
061 * 
062 *      public static void main(String[] args) {
063 *              ParameterBundle params = new DemoParameters();
064 *              System.out.println("p1 = \n" + params.printToString());
065 * 
066 *              GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(ParameterBundle.class.getSimpleName());
067 *              gd.addNumericField("some single int", 123, 0);
068 *              params.addToDialog(gd);
069 * 
070 *              gd.showDialog();
071 *              if (gd.wasCanceled())
072 *                      return;
073 * 
074 *              int singleInt = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
075 *              boolean success = params.getFromDialog(gd);
076 *              System.out.println("success = " + success);
077 *              System.out.println("p2 = \n" + params.printToString());
078 *      }
079 * }
080 * </pre>
081 * 
082 * @author WB
083 * @version 2022/02/02
084 * @version 2022/09/14 moved annotations and methods for {@link GenericDialog}
085 *          to {@link DialogUtils}
086 * @version 2022/11/23 added generic target type
087 * @param <TargetT> the target class to be parameterized
088 * 
089 * @see imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogDigits
090 * @see imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel
091 * @see imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogHide
092 */
093public interface ParameterBundle<TargetT> {
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns the valid parameter fields as an array. 
097         * @return the valid parameter fields
098         */
099        default Field[] getValidParameterFields() {
100                Class<?> clazz = this.getClass();
101                List<Field> validFields = new ArrayList<>();
102                for (Field f : clazz.getFields()) {
103                        if (isValidParameterField(f)) {
104                                validFields.add(f);
105                        }
106                }
107                return validFields.toArray(new Field[0]);
108        }
109        
110        /**
111         * Substitute for {@link Object#toString()}, which cannot be overridden by
112         * an interface's default method.
113         * 
114         * @return as string representation of theis parameter bundle
115         */
116        default String printToString() {
117                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
118                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
119                        printToStream(strm);
120                }
121                return bas.toString();
122        }
123
124        /**
125         * Sends a string representation of this parameter bundle to
126         * the specified stream.
127         * 
128         * @param strm the output stream
129         */
130        default void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
131                Class<?> clazz = this.getClass();
132                if (!Modifier.isPublic(clazz.getModifiers())) {
133                        strm.print("[WARNING] class " + clazz.getSimpleName() + " should be declared public or protected!\n");
134                }
135                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
136//              strm.println(clazz.getCanonicalName());
137                for (Field field : fields) {
138//                      if (!isValidParameterItem(field)) {
139//                              continue;
140//                      }
141                        strm.print(field.getType().getSimpleName() + " ");
142                        strm.print(field.getName() + " = ");
143                        try {
144                                strm.print(field.get(this).toString());
145                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
146                                strm.print("FIELD VALUE UNREADABLE!");
147                        }       
148                        strm.println();
149//                      int modifiers = field.getModifiers();
150//                      strm.println("Field is public = " + Modifier.isPublic(modifiers));
151//                      strm.println("Field is final = " + Modifier.isFinal(modifiers));
152                }
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * Validates the correctness and compatibility of the parameters in this bundle.
157         * Does nothing by default, implementing classes should override this method.
158         * 
159         * @return true if all parameters are OK, false otherwise
160         */
161        default boolean validate() {
162                return true;
163        }
164        
165        /**
166         * Returns true iff the specified field is a valid parameter item.
167         * This applies if the field is neither private nor final or static.
168         * @param f the field
169         * @return true if a valid parameter field
170         */
171        static boolean isValidParameterField(Field f) {
172                int mod = f.getModifiers();
173                if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
174                        return false;
175                }
176                else {
177                        return true;
178                }
179//              Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
180//              if (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == long.class || clazz == float.class || clazz == double.class || 
181//                      clazz == String.class || clazz.isEnum())
182//                      return true;
183//              else
184//                      return false;
185        }
186
187//      static void printModifiers(Field f) {
188//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
189//              System.out.println("Modifiers of field " + f.getName());
190//              System.out.println("abstract     = " + Modifier.isAbstract(mod));
191//              System.out.println("final        = " + Modifier.isFinal(mod));
192//              System.out.println("interface    = " + Modifier.isInterface(mod));
193//              System.out.println("native       = " + Modifier.isNative(mod));
194//              System.out.println("private      = " + Modifier.isPrivate(mod));
195//              System.out.println("protected    = " + Modifier.isProtected(mod));
196//              System.out.println("public       = " + Modifier.isPublic(mod));
197//              System.out.println("static       = " + Modifier.isStatic(mod));
198//              System.out.println("strict       = " + Modifier.isStrict(mod));
199//              System.out.println("synchronized = " + Modifier.isSynchronized(mod));
200//              System.out.println("transient    = " + Modifier.isTransient(mod));
201//              System.out.println("volatite     = " + Modifier.isVolatile(mod));
202//      }
203
204        
205        /**
206         * Returns a shallow copy of the specified {@link ParameterBundle}
207         * instance.
208         * 
209         * @param <T> generic type
210         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
211         * @return a copy with the same type, fields and values as the original instance
212         */
213        public static <T extends ParameterBundle<?>> T duplicate(T params) {
214            return ObjectUtils.copy(params);
215        }
216
